definitions.body: tumult, confusion, disquietde, discomfiture—abs. ´[[מ]] De 7:23 + 7 t. ; cstr. [[מְהוּמַת]] 1Sa 5:11, Ez Eze 22:5; pl. abs. [[מְהוּמוֹת]] 2Ch 15:5, [[מְהוּמׂת]] Am 3:9; —

tumult, confusion Am 3:9 (‖[[עֲשׁוּקִים]] oppression), disturbance, turmoil (opp. peace) 2Ch 15:5 (‖ vb. [[המם]] v:2Ch 15:6), cf. Ez Eze 22:5; disquietude (of mind) Pr 15:16; esp. tumult & confusion, panic, as due to divine judgment ´[[מְהוּמַת־י]] Zec 14:13 cf. Ez Eze 7:7; also 1Sa 5:9 and [[מְהוּמַת מָוֶת]] v:1Sa 5:11.

discomfiture, (due to ´[[י]]) in war 1Sa 14:20 (cf. v:1Sa 14:15, v:1Sa 14:22); De 7:23 (acc. cogn. c. [[הום]] q.v.), De 28:20 (‖[[מְאֵרָה]], [[מִגְעֶרֶת]]); cf. ´[[יוֹם מ]] 1Sa 22:5 (‖[[מְבוּסָה]], [[מְבוּכָה]]) a day of discomfiture & down-treading & confusion.
